result.execSummary:
All charges against Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:08 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF58, 22CF134, 22CF264, & 22CF370. ADA Ellenwood recites joint recommendation.  Atty Davis agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping-Felony in 22CF264 and G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping Felony in 22CF370.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF264 & Ct 1 in 22CF370.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF264 and Ct 2-5 in 22CF370, Court also dismisses 22CF58 & 22CF134.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF264

S/W 2 Years Probation  Concurrent with current probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Surcharge: $250
 Apply Bond to Atty Fees. If remaining money, apply to costs/surcharge, balance to be paid through probation

INCLUDES 20CF323 (SEH), 21CF525 (SEH), 22CF58 (STC), 22CF134 (STC), 22CF264 (STC) and 22CF370 (STC). 22CF370: QUASH WARRANT. 20CF323 and 21CF525: Court reads charge and maximum penalty. PSI completed by Agent Volz. Counsel has no corrections to PSI. Sentencing arguments. 

Court orders: 
20CF323
Ct 1 - OWI 4th
S/W 4 years probation with conditions:
- 8 months conditional jail time - Huber authorized for employment and seek work
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Testing random and regulary
- Complete Domestic Violence assessment and follow through with recommendations
- No contact with Catherine G., except for child custody exchanges and child care and comply with child protection order
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting
- Participate in Moral Reconation Therapy
- 3 years driver's license revocation
- 3 years IID
- Complete Driver's Safety Plan
- Fine $1,744; inclusive of costs and surcharge

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:28 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius. DE: Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann pro se.  Includes 20CF323 (STC), 21CF525 (STC), 22CF58 (PH), & 22CF134 (PH).  Court reviews files and states Agent Volz is here in person today and on 20CF323 & 21CF525 Agent has had issues completing the PSI due to DE not responding to her coorespondence.  DE states he will return paperwork and return phone calls when necessary.  Agent Volz states she will need 60 days from today to complete PSI. Court orders DE to do what is necessary to complete PSI or warrant will be issued.  Atty. Satorius states they will do waiver for PH on 22CF58 & 22CF134.    Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Attys would like to proceed with ARGN.  ADA Ellenwood states information will mirror complaint in 22CF58.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  ADA Ellenwood states information will mirror complaint in 22CF134.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:43 AM Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
